xxl.io
Class FileInputIterator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.AbstractCursor
        |
        +--xxl.io.InputIterator
              |
              +--xxl.io.FileInputIterator
Direct Known Subclasses:
FloatPointInputIterator, KPEInputIterator, RectangleInputIterator
public class FileInputIterator
extends InputIterator

This class provides an iterator that depends on a given file. It iterates over the objects that are read out of the underlying file. A converter is used in order to read out the serialized objects.

This class implements only a few constructors. These constructers create an new input iterator that depends on a file input stream.
Example usage (1). 

     // create a new file

     File file = new File("file.dat");

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // create a random access file on that file

         RandomAccessFile output = new RandomAccessFile(file, "rw");

         // write some data to that file

         output.writeUTF("Some data.");
         output.writeUTF("More data.");
         output.writeUTF("Another bundle of data.");
         output.writeUTF("A last bundle of data.");

         // close the random access file

         output.close();
     }
     catch (Exception e) {
         System.out.println("An error occured.");
     }

     // create a new file input iterator with ...

     FileInputIterator iterator = new FileInputIterator(

         // a string converter

         StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

         // the created file

         file
     );

     // print all elements of the iterator

     while (iterator.hasNext())
         System.out.println(iterator.next());

     // delete the file

     file.delete();

See Also:
BufferedInputStream, DataInputStream, File, FileInputStream, Function, IOException, WrappingRuntimeException

Constructor Detail

FileInputIterator

public FileInputIterator(Converter converter,
                         File file,
                         int bufferSize)
Constructs a new FileInputIterator that depends on the specified file and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects. An internal buffer of size bufferSize is used for the file input.
Parameters:
converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
bufferSize - the size of the buffer that is used for the file input

FileInputIterator

public FileInputIterator(Function newObject,
                         File file,
                         int bufferSize)
Constructs a new FileInputIterator that depends on the specified file and uses the specified factory method for initializing an object of this iteration before the file is read out. When using this constructor the objects of the iteration must implement the Convertable interface. An internal buffer of size bufferSize is used for the file input.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of new FileInputIterator(new ConvertableConverter(newObject), file, bufferSize).
Parameters:
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing an object of this iteration before the file is read out.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
bufferSize - the size of the buffer that is used for the file input

FileInputIterator

public FileInputIterator(Converter converter,
                         File file)
Constructs a new FileInputIterator that depends on the specified file and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of new FileInputIterator(converter, file, 4096).
Parameters:
converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.

FileInputIterator

public FileInputIterator(Function newObject,
                         File file)
Constructs a new FileInputIterator that depends on the specified file and uses the specified factory method for initializing an object of this iteration before the file is read out. When using this constructor the objects of the iteration must implement the Convertable interface.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of new FileInputIterator(new ConvertableConverter(newObject), file, 4096).
Parameters:
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing an object of this iteration before the file is read out.
file - the file that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a FileInputIterator. It can also be used to test the functionality of a FileInputIterator.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
